definition: in fact/in reality/actually/as a matter of fact/de facto/ipso facto

pinyin: shi4 shi2 sheng4 yu2 xiong2 bian4

definition: to seek the truth from facts
present the facts and reason things out
pinyin: bai3 shi4 shi2 jiang3 dao4 li3

sentences.english: As soon as you prove to be good, you will get more followers.
sentences.chinese: 如果事實證明你還不錯，必定會有更多追隨者。

sentences.english: The fifth is Old-type News Facts.
As a matter of fact, Edward was very fond of cooking and foodstuff.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，愛德華非常喜歡烹飪和食品。

sentences.english: It was time to write down and acknowledge that he was gone.
sentences.chinese: 這是記下和承認它已經離去這一事實的時候。

sentences.english: In fact, I usually don't catch anything.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，我通常什麼都釣不上來。

sentences.english: The fact that you have control over all the clients helps.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，你能夠控制所有客戶的話是很有幫助的。

sentences.english: Indeed, there are a fair number of Mr. Lonelyhearts on campus.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，孤獨先生在校園裏確實不少。

sentences.english: As it is I have been forced into becoming a sort of pamphleteer.
sentences.chinese: 事實是，我被迫成了一名寫小冊子的作家。

sentences.english: But how could we disguise the fact that I was not [even] fifteen years old?
sentences.chinese: 可我們怎麼才能掩飾我還不到15足歲的事實呢？

sentences.english: But the scene is actually an optical illusion.
sentences.chinese: 而事實上，這樣的場景只是一種光學錯覺。

sentences.english: This part faces the reality that history often repeats itself.
sentences.chinese: 這部分是關於直面歷史不斷重演的事實。

sentences.english: Libertarian says you can't know just from the facts I've just given you.
sentences.chinese: 他們說，你不能僅從這個事實來判斷。

sentences.english: Ink to write that, should hide the facts written in blood.
sentences.chinese: 墨寫的謊說，決掩不住血寫的事實。

sentences.english: Failure to include substantiating facts and figures on the market is likely to result in a Fail grade.
sentences.chinese: 不包括充實市場上的事實和數字是可能導致故障品位。

sentences.english: But in fact it was McEwan's funniest novel for years.
sentences.chinese: 但是事實上這是他數年來最爲風趣的一本著作。

definition: after all/all in all/when all is said and done/in the final analysis
only/merely/nothing but/no more than/it's just that ...
regarding/as far as sth is concerned/with regards to
to admit/to concede/to recognize/recognition (diplomatic, artistic etc)/to acknowledge
only natural/as it should be/certainly/of course/without doubt
